ios.subtitle: The moving story of a lifetime
More A Little to the Left!

editorialNotes.standard: Neatly arranging fountain pens and acrylic paints not only declutters drawers and cupboards but also soothes our minds.

ios.subtitle: Trickier A Little to the Left

editorialNotes.standard: Use curious elevators to cross beautiful buildings in a puzzler that’s as stylish as it is confounding.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Tiny Wings has been a longtime favorite of ours, thanks to its gentle vibe, fantastic music, and surprisingly awesome one-touch gameplay. Outrunning the sun across procedurally generated islands is rewarding and relaxing, and we love the added challenge of the four-bird race mode. The game’s vivid, vibrant colors absolutely dazzle on Apple TV—we feel like we’re meeting our flightless friends for the first time again.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Mash through waves of foes as a heavily armed potato in this spud-tacular arena survival game.
Pencil in time for nostalgic cannon duels in this hand-drawn reimagining of an old-school classic, where cannonballs fly while scribbled tumbleweeds bounce across graphite landscapes.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: A Dance of Fire and Ice

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: No! No! No! NO! No? No. No!

editorialNotes.standard: With surreal illustrations and fruit-headed characters, this point-and-click adventure is as strange as it is clever.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Peek under roofs and rummage through spaceships to track down objects in this delightful time-hopping puzzler.

Terry Cavanagh’s Super Hexagon is quite simply one of the most challenging games we’ve ever played. A pulsating chiptunes soundtrack underscores the danger as swirling walls close in around you and you race to escape the contracting maze. With the geometric action heaping on the punishment (the easiest difficulty is appropriately labeled “Hard”), every small achievement feels like a massive victory, whether you’re topping your high score or overcoming a singularly tricky section.
editorialNotes.short: This is still one of our favorites. Few games are this satisfying to master.

editorialNotes.tagline: Our favourite love guru is back!

name: Willy's Wonderland
artistName: QUByte Games Desenvolvimento de Jogos LTDA

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

If you took Super Hexagon, Impossible Road, and Tempest and shoved them in a blender, the resulting smoothie would probably taste like Octagon. It’s a psychedelic infinite runner backed by lean-mean electronic music and a difficulty that’ll have you begging for mercy while you tap Retry.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.short: This stylish runner made a big impact when it first launched, and it's still a blast.
editorialNotes.standard: Race through a collapsing city in a game that helped launch the infinite runner genre. From its gorgeous music to its searing imagery—exploding windows, falling buildings—Canabalt overflows with style and atmosphere. Surviving even a single minute requires split-second reflexes and a whole lot of luck. Plus, after years of updates—including all-new modes like shared-screen multiplayer—this already epic game has been polished to perfection.

A thrilling, lightning-paced action-platformer, Shadow Blade challenges you to dodge deadly obstacles, collect items, and battle swarms of evil enemies—all while racing to the end of each level. Memorable art and music make navigating each maze-like area a wonderfully rewarding experience, while excellent level design and accessible virtual controls will keep you coming back until you’ve mastered every stage.

Screen-searing graphics, great controls, white-knuckle action—Shadow Blade: Reload boasts all the ingredients for ninja-game magic. Its side-scrolling gameplay deftly blends wall-jumping acrobatics and sword-swinging combat, while motion-comic interludes lay out a sizzling story. And once you’ve mastered the campaign, you can prove your skills in a challenge mode aimed at the fiercest of warriors.

ios.subtitle: Classic idle game with no ads

name: 环球酒店大亨
artistName: Shenzhen Jingying Network Technology Co., Ltd.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore the nature of AI—and learn a thing or two about yourself—in this snappy RPG that doubles as a personality test.
A talking goat ate your grimoire! Relearn recipes by collecting reagents and tricking folks in this bewitchingly fun fairy tale.

This clever physics-based puzzle game challenges you to spray water to extinguish fires and manipulate the environment. Its simple, clearly defined mechanics allow for intuitive, satisfying puzzle-solving. New elements are routinely layered in, ensuring that the challenges stay interesting. Great visuals and impressive sound also set Sprinkle Islands apart.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A severe allergy to eggs isn’t funny—unless it hatches a fantastic voyage through a world full of golden nuggets, homicidal chickens, and puke. So. Much. Puke. The controls in this bizarrely clever platformer are spot on, but sometimes we’re giggling so hard at our barf-propelled hero that we slip up and die laughing. It truly is an Eggggg-cellent adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche you’ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

The virtual Rube Goldberg machines that make up Perchang’s gorgeous levels are so lovely to look at that you might forget what you’re here to do—move marbles into their proper pipes. With contraptions ranging from flippers to conveyer belts at your disposal, this inventive 3D puzzler requires an intoxicating mix of skill, smarts, and laser-sharp focus.
